itemDescription: British recipient of the Victoria Cross

wikipedia_page.main: Major General Sir Howard Craufurd Elphinstone,  (12 December 1829 – 8 March 1890) was a British Army officer and a recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: List of Victoria Cross recipients of uncertain nationality

response: * Robert S. McClintock, who married Mary Elphinstone, the youngest daughter of Major General Sir Howard Craufurd Elphinstone.
*Sir Howard Craufurd Elphinstone (1829–1890), Major-General in the Crimean War
* Lieut. Howard Craufurd Elphinstone, Royal Engineers, winning the V.C. at Sebastopol, 18 June 1855 (Royal Engineers Museum, Chatham)
*Howard Craufurd Elphinstone VC KCB CMG (1829–1890), recipient of the Victoria Cross
** Sir Howard Craufurd Elphinstone VC (1829–1890), British Army general
